intro: Barnadesia, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, well-drained soils. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a slightly hairy texture. Barnadesia is native to North America and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
